definition: To change something slightly; to make different without turning it into something else.
examples: We altered the plan after the weather report.
She will alter the trousers to fit better.

extra.memory_tip: Alter = a little change at the ‘altar’.

definition: To make someone unable to think clearly; to mix things up.
examples: The tricky question confused many students.
Don’t confuse salt with sugar.

extra.memory_tip: Con-fuse = fuse things together so they’re unclear.

definition: To give or deliver to many people or places; to spread out.
examples: Please distribute the worksheets to each table.
Wind distributes seeds across the field.

definition: To force out or throw out.
examples: The referee ejected the player from the match.
Press this button to eject the disc.

definition: To hold someone closely in your arms; to gladly accept an idea; an act of holding someone.
examples: They embraced at the station. (verb)
Her embrace was warm and kind. (noun)

definition: To provide with the things needed for a task.
examples: The lab is equipped with safety goggles.
We equipped the hikers with maps and water.

definition: Able to bend or change easily without breaking; willing to change plans.
examples: Rubber is flexible.
Our timetable is flexible this week.

extra.memory_tip: Flexible = flex and bend without breaking.

definition: Happening immediately; a very short moment.
examples: She got an instant reply. (adjective)
Wait just an instant, please. (noun)

definition: Very eager or interested; sharp or quick (as in senses or mind).
examples: She is keen to learn coding.
An owl has keen hearing.

definition: Not firm or strong; to walk with difficulty because of an injury; an uneven walk.
examples: The flowers looked limp without water. (adjective)
He limped after twisting his ankle. (verb)

extra.memory_tip: Limp = limp leaves or a limping walk.

definition: To move quickly with short, hurried steps; a quick, confused rush.
examples: Mice scurried across the path. (verb)
There was a scurry to pack before the rain. (noun)

definition: To take hold of suddenly and firmly; to take by force or legal authority.
examples: She seized the rope before it slipped away.
Officials seized the smuggled goods.

extra.memory_tip: Seize the moment = grab it fast.

definition: Not deep; lacking depth of thought or feeling; to make or become less deep.
examples: The water is shallow near the shore. (adjective)
The stream shallowed after the dry spell. (verb)

definition: To be all around something or someone; the area or things that are around.
examples: Trees surround the playground. (verb)
The fireplace had a marble surround. (noun)

extra.memory_tip: Surround = circle it on all sides.

definition: A person who is harmed or suffers because of a crime, accident, or event.
examples: The victims of the storm received help.
A scam can make someone a victim.

extra.memory_tip: Victim = the one affected by harm.
